meanings.definition: Incapable of being overcome or solved.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was insuperable for the hikers, as they could not climb it.
meanings.sent2: The team faced an insuperable challenge when trying to fix the broken machine.
meanings.sent3: The insuperable puzzle left everyone scratching their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of spiders was insuperable, making her scream at the sight of one.
meanings.sent5: The insuperable problem loomed over them like a dark cloud, casting a shadow on their progress.

meanings.sent1: The athlete's speed was insuperable, leaving his competitors far behind.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the sunset was insuperable, painting the sky in breathtaking colors.
meanings.sent3: The insuperable talent of the young musician amazed the audience beyond words.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was insuperable, setting a high standard for his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The insuperable joy of the children playing in the park was contagious, spreading smiles to all around.
